snippet: Jonathan Dwyer of the Arizona Cardinals was arrested in a domestic violence case Wednesday as the league continued to find itself under siege for its handling of such cases.
abstract: Arizona Cardinals running back Jonathan Dwyer is arrested on charges aggravated assault in domestic violence case stemming from two separate episodes at his home in southeast Phoenix in July 2014, adding to the NFL's off-field turmoil; Dwyer, who was deactivated by the Cardinals, denies that any physical assaults took place.

byline.original: By PAT BORZI and STEVE EDER
byline.contributor: Steve Eder reported from New York, and Ken Belson contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Jonathan Dwyer of the Arizona Cardinals was arrested in a domestic violence case Wednesday as the league continued to find itself under siege for its handling of such cases.

headline.seo: Cardinals’ Jonathan Dwyer Arrested as Adrian Peterson and Greg Hardy Leave Teams
headline.main: Assault Charges Add to N.F.L.’s Off-Field Turmoil
headline.print_headline: Arrest Adds to N.F.L.’s Off-Field Turmoil
